detaileddescription.para: Complete door unlock

Used to set central door locking mode to complete door unlock.
value 0x00U
Single dooor unlock

Used to set central door locking mode to single door unlock.
value 0x01U
Side selective door unlock

Used to set central door locking mode to side selective door unlock.
value 0x02U
Unexpected door unlock

Used to set central door locking mode to unexpected door unlock.
value 0xFFU
Autolock active

Used to set autolock active.
values TRUE
Autolock not active

Used to set autolock inactive.
value FALSE
SOK timer start value

Used to set timer SOK to initial value.
values 0x00U
SOK timer limit

Used to incremet challengeCounterZV_SOK_u8 until this limit.
value 0x10U limit = 160 ms ZVAD cyclic task period = 10 ms
SOK challange set

Used for setting challange authentication.
value TRUE
SOK challange clear

Used for clearing challange authentication.
value FALSE
CMD open

Used for reading SOK open command.
value 0x01U
CMD trunk

Used for reading SOK trunk command.
value 0x02U
CMD close no save

Used for reading SOK close no save command.
value 0x30U
CMD toggle

Used for reading SOK toggle command.
value 0xFEU
SOK response timeout

Used for setting ZV_SOK_Resp_04_timeout_u8.
value 0x1EU
SDK KESSY TRIG ARR

Used to define kessyTriggers and previous kessyTriggers arrays sizes in ZVAD_SOK_Kessy_Result.
value 0x9U
SDK ZV TRIG ARR

Used to define zvTriggers and previous zvTriggers arrays sizes in ZVAD_SOK_ZV_Result.
value 0x9U
FAHRSTUFE init

Used for setting fahrstufe init status.
value 0x00U
FAHRSTUFE unlocked

Used for setting fahrstufe unlocked status.
value 0x01U
FAHRSTUFE locked

Used for setting fahrstufe locked status.
value 0x02U
FAHRSTUFE failure

Used for setting fahrstufe failure status.
value 0x03U
Parking state - failure

Used to set parking status to failure
value 0x0FU
Parking state - init

Used to set parking status to init
value 0x01U
Parking state - position P

Used to set parking status to position P
value 0x5FU
Automatic gearbox

Used to set gearbox type
value 0x00U
DIETA unlock

Used for setting DIETA unlock.
value 0x02U
DIETA lock

Used for setting DIETA lock.
value 0x03U
HV timer stop

Used for checking if HV timer is stopped.
value 0x00U
HV timer start

Used for setting start value of HV timer.
value 0x65U
Max speed

Used in ZVAD_GeschwErr to check value of vSignalESP_u16.
value 0xFFFCU
No Communication Request

Used in ZVAD_NetworkManagement to check enComUserRequestReason for ZV, KFT and QTG.
value 0U
Communication Requets min

Used in ZVAD_CommRequestZV to check ComUserRequestReason for ZV.
value 1U
Communication Requets max

Used in ZVAD_CommRequestZV to check ComUserRequestReason for ZV.
value 28U
DWA Communication requets min

Used in ZVAD_CommRequestDWA to check ComUserRequestReason for DWA.
value 30U
DWA Communication requets 34

Used in ZVAD_NetworkManagement to check ComUserRequestReason for DWA.
value 34U
DWA Communication requets 35

Used in ZVAD_NetworkManagement to check ComUserRequestReason for DWA.
value 35U
DWA Communication requets max

Used in ZVAD_CommRequestDWA to check ComUserRequestReason for DWA.
value 39U
DWA Communication requets 50

Used in ZVAD_CommRequestKFT to check ComUserRequestReason for KFT.
value 50U
DWA Communication requets 52

Used in ZVAD_CommRequestKFT to check ComUserRequestReason for KFT.
value 52U
DWA Communication requets 53

Used in ZVAD_CommRequestKFT to check ComUserRequestReason for KFT.
value 53U
QTG Communication requets

Used in ZVAD_CommRequestQTG to check ComUserRequestReason for QTG.
value 60U
Unknown communication request

Used in ZVAD_CommRequest functions for QTG, KFT, DWA, ZV to check enComUserRequestReason.
value 255U
ZVAD no communication request

Used to set comCDLrequest in ZVAD_NewtworkManagement.
value 0x00U
ZVAD communication request all

Used to set comCDLrequest in ZVAD_NewtworkManagement.
value 0x01U
ZVAD communication request lin

Used to set comCDLrequest in ZVAD_NewtworkManagement.
value 0x02U
ZVAD communication request PDC

Used to set comCDLrequest in ZVAD_NewtworkManagement.
value 0x03U
GE Fahrstufe Init

Used to initialize Pim_ZVAD_PIM_Fahrstufe_ROM and Pim_ZVAD_PIM_Fahrstufe_FirstVal.
value 0x01U
ZVAD VIT MAX

Used to initialize VIT timer.
value 0x96U init = 1500 ms ZVAD cyclic task period = 10 ms
ZVAD VIT HECKVERR

Used to check numLetzteBE in ZVAD_VIT function.
value 37U
ZVAD VIT KYS HECKVERR

Used to check numLetzteBE in ZVAD_VIT function.
value 47U
CAN Mirror offset

Offset from OSEK_Buffer_Start to RTE_Buffer_Star.
value 0x01000000UL
PiLoPa Remote Control active

Used in ZVAD_checkRPAState to set numPilPaAktivOUT.
value 0x03U
PiLoPa Remote no system active

Used in ZVAD_checkRPAState to set numPilPaAktivOUT.
value 0x00U
For SWATT testing
SWATT bypassing used for testing.

briefdescription.para: K2CAN bus; K2CAN will be used as KCAN because the interface receives the same output.

detaileddescription.para: ZVAD CANs
This enumeration contains the CANs used to monitor their activity status
ZVAD PDUs
This enumeration contains the PDUs used for communication error status handling
RTE Read Typedef
Typedef used for RTE Read function pointers
Bus states array

This array stores the bus states for each bus
For each position in array: range True if corresponding bus is active False otherwise values N/A unit N/A resolution N/A context ZVAD_ReadCANStates, ZVAD_UpdatePduCounters, ZVAD_GetKommErrorStatus protection none storage class init ram
Security Relevance
Not Security-Relevant.
PDU Timeout counter array

This array stores the timer values for each PDU used for communication error status handling. The values are stored as tens of miliseconds, because the ZVAD component is running cyclically at 10ms
For each position in array: range uint16 values N/A unit 10s of ms resolution N/A context ZVAD_InitPduTimeoutCounters, ZVAD_UpdatePduCounters, ZVAD_GetKommErrorStatus protection none storage class init ram
Security Relevance
Not Security-Relevant.

memberdef.name: constZVAD_Msg

detaileddescription.para: PDU data structures array

This array stores the information about each PDU used for communication error status handling. We map each PDU to their PDU Statuses, buses and timeout values The timeout values are calculated based on the KMatrix PDU's normal cycle time * 10ms.
range N/A values N/A unit N/A resolution N/A context ZVAD_InitPduTimeoutCounters, ZVAD_UpdatePduCounters, ZVAD_GetKommErrorStatus protection none storage class init ram
Security Relevance
Not Security-Relevant.
Pim ZVAD PIM Fahrstufe ROM

Pim ZVAD PIM Fahrstufe ROM is set to ZVAD_GE_FAHRSTUFE_INIT value.
range N/A value ZVAD_GE_FAHRSTUFE_INIT unit N/A resolution N/A context task protection none storage class init ram
Pointer array to functions that return Std_ReturnType

This array points to functions like Rte_Read_ZVAD_WakeupSleep_s_[CAN_BUS]_Comm_Active, which provide CAN_BUS activity status
range Std_ReturnType - see Std_Types.h values N/A unit N/A resolution N/A context KFTX_CheckCANstate protection none storage class init ram
Timer SOK active

Flag used for SOK timer activation.
range TRUE when ZVAD_SOK_ExternalTrigger is called and at least one of variables triggerSokFromCmd_bo, triggerSokFromKessy_bo, triggerSokFromZV_bo is TRUE FALSE when function ZVAD_InitVarFunc is called and at ZVAD_SOK_ChallengeTimer call when challengeCounterZV_SOK_u8 became equal to ZVAD_SOK_TIMER_LIMIT values N/A unit N/A resolution N/A context task protection none storage class init ram
Timer SOK Resp02 timeout value

Flag used to measure time related to SOK challenge.
range ZVAD_SOK_RESPONSE_TIMEOUT when function ZV_SOK_HW_BCM_Resp_02 is called Decrement until 0x00U when ZVAD_SOK_PrepareResponse is called and bStrgHDFedersteller_bo is FALSE and counter is different than 0x00 0x00U when when ZVAD_SOK_PrepareResponse is called and bStrgHDFedersteller_bo is TRUE and counter is different than 0x00 values N/A unit N/A resolution N/A context task protection none storage class init ram
Timer SOK Resp03 timeout value

Flag used to measure time related to SOK challenge.
range ZVAD_SOK_RESPONSE_TIMEOUT when function ZV_SOK_HFS_BCM_Resp_03 is called Decrement until 0x00U when ZVAD_SOK_PrepareResponse is called and both values of evHFSEntrSoll_bo and evZentEntsSoll_bo are FALSE and counter is different than 0x00 0x00U when when ZVAD_SOK_PrepareResponse is called and at least one value of evHFSEntrSoll_bo or evZentEntsSoll_bo is TRUE and counter is different than 0x00 values N/A unit N/A resolution N/A context task protection none storage class init ram
Timer SOK Resp04 timeout value

Flag used to measure time related to SOK challenge.
range ZVAD_SOK_RESPONSE_TIMEOUT when function ZV_SOK_HBFS_BCM_Resp_04 is called Decrement until 0x00U when ZVAD_SOK_PrepareResponse is called and both values of evHBFSEntrSoll_bo and evZentEntsSoll_bo are FALSE and counter is different than 0x00 0x00U when when ZVAD_SOK_PrepareResponse is called and at least one value of evHBFSEntrSoll_bo or evZentEntsSoll_bo is TRUE and counter is different than 0x00 values N/A unit N/A resolution N/A context task protection none storage class init ram
Pim ZVAD PIM Fahrstufe FirstVal

Used to store first value of Pim_ZVAD_PIM_Fahrstufe from NvM.
range Pim_ZVAD_PIM_Fahrstufe when function NvmSingleZVAD_FahrstufeCbk is called and a_uServ is equal to NVM_READ_BLOCK values N/A unit N/A resolution N/A context task protection none storage class init ram
Can message error handling function.

Function which provides status of CAN message and maps values of timeout and init according to ZV lib requirements, in respect to message status and CAN state (active/inactive). Refer to functions ZVAD_FahrStufe() and ZVAD_GeschwErr().
reentrant No context task Model Task thread safe No multicore safe No synchronous
Security Relevance
Not Security-Relevant.
uint8
msgStatus [in] - variable that indicated if it is noError, timeout or init state
CAN_StateZv
canNumber_e [in] - variable which idicates if the activation of ACAN, FCAN or KCAN should be done.
boolean retStatus range FALSE when msgStatus is 0 (noError) or when msgStatus is 2 (timeout) and isCANactive_bo is FALSE. TRUE when msgStatus is 2 (timeout) and isCANactive_bo is TRUE or when msgStatus is different than 0 and 2. resolution factor = 1 offset = 0. unit N/A
Globals
N/A Call Sequence
Test Method
the testing method is described on: Test case shall be based on values of msgStatus. TEST_ZVAD_Task__ZVAD_CanMessageErrorHandling
Traceability
Design Decision - Justification. According to the architecture this is a helper function which checks the CAN state.

This function cyclically reads and stores the state of the buses that are used by the communication error status signals

Design Decision - Justification. According to the architecture this is a helper function which reads the CAN state.
Function that cyclically updates the pdu counters

This function cyclically updates the pdu counters accordingly to the communication error status requirements. After each BUS WAKE-UP, the counters are reset. They are decrementing only if the BUS WAKE-UP is not finished (after the timeout has elapsed or when we receive a NoError pdu status).
reentrant No context ZVAD_TaskCyclicEvent thread safe No multicore safe No synchronous
Security Relevance
Not Security-Relevant.
void
void
Globals
ZVAD_BUS_STATES [in] ZVAD_PDU_TIMEOUT_COUNTERS [in]
Call Sequence
Test Method
the testing method is described on: Test case shall check if the timers are working according to the requirements. TEST_ZVAD_Task__ZVAD_UpdatePduCounters
Satisfies requirement
SWR_ICAS1_L3_ZV_1485
Function the returns the communication error status for a specific PDU

This function cyclically updates the pdu counters accordingly to the communication error status requirements. After each BUS WAKE-UP, the counters are reset. They are decrementing only if the BUS WAKE-UP is not finished (after the timeout has elapsed or when we receive a NoError pdu status).
reentrant No context ZVAD_Rear_Doors_Status, ZVAD_PduStatusTimeoutErr, ZVAD_GeschwErr thread safe No multicore safe No synchronous
Security Relevance
Not Security-Relevant.
eZVAD_PDU
pdu [in] - the PDU data
uint8 - the communication error status for the PDU
Globals
constZVAD_Msg [in] RTE_CAN_MIRROR_OFFSET [in] ZVAD_BUS_STATES [in] ZVAD_PDU_TIMEOUT_COUNTERS [in]
Call Sequence
Test Method
the testing method is described on: Test case shall check if the timers are working according to the requirements. TEST_ZVAD_Task__ZVAD_GetKommErrorStatus
Satisfies requirement
Design Decision - Justification. This is a helper function to provide the status of CAN message for some errSt signals.
Helper function that returns the communication status based on the state of the bus, the pdu status and the timeout timer value

This function sets the communication error status based on the requirements. While bus sleep, the communication status should be set to init value. If bus is active, if PDU status is NoError, the communication status is set to NoError, else if the timeout is not elapsed, we set it to init (bus is not fully awake), otherwise, the communication status is set to error.
reentrant No context ZVAD_GetKommErrorStatus thread safe No multicore safe No synchronous
Security Relevance
Not Security-Relevant.
boolean
isBusActive [in] - corresponding bus state
uint8
u8IPduStatus [in] - corresponding PDU status
uint16
u16PduTimeoutCounter [in] - corresponding timeout counter
uint8 - the communication error status for the PDU
Globals
Rte_StatusMask_NoError [in]
Call Sequence
Test Method
the testing method is described on: Test case shall check if the timers are working according to the requirements. TEST_ZVAD_Task__ZVAD_CAN_KommErrorStatusDelayCounter
Satisfies requirement
Design Decision - Justification. Helper function used to manage the delay counter and delayed timeout for each CAN.
Function that sets the rear doors error status.

Function which provides rear doors (HFS-left back door and HBFS-right back door) error status signals according to TSG configuration (activated when sliding doors are present), SAM configuration, configurations of car doors number (fourDoors) and sliding doors status(Schiebetuer_hbfs and Schiebetuer_hfs indicating if there are normal doors or sliding doors).
fourDoors
- represents if the car either has 4 doors (value true) or 2 doors (value false). range boolean resolution N/A unit N/A
tsgConfigured
- represents if either TSG is configured (value true) or not (value false). range boolean resolution N/A unit N/A
samConfigured
- represents if either SAM is configured (value true) or not (value false). range boolean resolution N/A unit N/A
void
Globals
ZVAD_TSG_HFS_01 [in] ZVAD_TSG_HBFS_01 [in] ZVAD_SAM_01 [in]
reentrant No context ZVAD_AdapterA thread safe No multicore safe No synchronous
Security Relevance
Not Security-Relevant. Call Sequence
Test Method
The test method is described in: The testcase shall be created to check if the rear door error statuses are set accordingly to the configurations of TSG, SAM, car doors number and sliding doors. TEST_ZVAD_Task__ZVAD_Rear_Doors_Status
Traceability
Satisfies requirement

RteLight function for providing an address which will help determine the status of CAN messages.

Helping function which provides the status of CAN message (noError, timeout or init) for ZV lib needs in the function ZVAD_GetKommErrorStatus. Calculates RteLight base address minus core offset.
reentrant No context ZVAD_GetKommErrorStatus thread safe No multicore safe No synchronous
Security Relevance
Not Security-Relevant.
void*

uint32
u32CoreOffset [in] - which is the core offset.

Globals

Traceability

detaileddescription.para: Function that sets rear doors status.
Sets rear doors status validity taking into account the status of SAM and TSG configurations and also the error status provided by doors PDUs.

detaileddescription.para: Updates the value and status of the output signals configured as implicit.

Prepares the rte buffers for signals having range check activated.
The function needs to be called before any runnable call. its handles the status flags and last valid values.
Init the variables for the ZVAD module.
This function is called by ModelsTask before starting the model (MmDoSetup is called).
